pr_title: PHOENIX-6155 : Provide a coprocessor endpoint to avoid direct upserts into SYSTEM.TASK from the client

timeline.author: ChinmaySKulkarni
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -431,6 +431,8 @@ public SQLException newException(SQLExceptionInfo info) {
             PTable.LinkType.CHILD_TABLE + ") for view"),
     TABLE_NOT_IN_REGION(1145, "XCL45", "No modifications allowed on this table. "

+    UNABLE_TO_UPSERT_TASK(1146, "XCL46",

timeline.bodyText: If SYSTEM.TASK already exists on a cluster and you upgrade to 4.16 server bits and connect with a 4.16 client, will we still install this new coproc or does that need extra steps in the upgrade path?
timeline.author: ChinmaySKulkarni

replies.bodyText:
Yes, we would need to take care of upgrade path. Updated PR with changes in upgradeSystemTask() function by handling addition of this new coprocessor, test is available in BackwardCompatibilityIT for existence of new coprocessor in updated table descriptor.
Thanks for the suggestion @ChinmaySKulkarni
replies.author: virajjasani

timeline.bodyText: If other mutations were made using the same connection, we will be returning the joined state of all of them here right? Don't we want to restrict to just returning mutations corresponding to the upsert into the SYSTEM.TASK table?
timeline.author: ChinmaySKulkarni

timeline.bodyText: I'm not sure I understand this comment. We want to use the endpoint if triggered from client-side right? Can you please explain the use of useTaskEndpoint?
timeline.author: ChinmaySKulkarni

timeline.bodyText: I'm unclear on the use of useTaskEndpoint. Here we are calling the endpoint anyways. In which cases are we planning on not using the endpoint? server-side invocations?
timeline.author: ChinmaySKulkarni

+                                        .setUseTaskEndpoint(true).build());

replies.bodyText: Right, we don't need this specifically if client is going to use separate method for retrieving mutation list. Updated the patch accordingly.
replies.author: virajjasani

PHOENIX-6155 : Provide a coprocessor endpoint to avoid direct upserts into SYSTEM.TASK from the client

timeline.bodyText: I don't think this is a good idea. Instead why not just create a separate connectionOnServer and ensure that it contains just the mutations related to SYSTEM.TASK?
timeline.author: ChinmaySKulkarni

replies.bodyText:
Added new connection in getMutationsForAddTask() to resolve this.
Thanks
replies.author: virajjasani

timeline.bodyText: Can it not be that the first next() gave you mutations corresponding to some other upsert/delete? Let's just use our own connection
timeline.author: ChinmaySKulkarni

timeline.bodyText: Can we extract the this part into a small helper method? The else case is similar to the if just that we aren't running with impersonation
timeline.author: ChinmaySKulkarni

timeline.bodyText:
Can we rename this variable? Sounds like it is set to false when we don't really want to commit, but rather just get the stmt object which we later use to get the List<Mutation>. This is used just for the index rebuild task that gets triggered from the client-side, right? For the tasks that are triggered from the server (i.e. from MetaDataEndpointImpl and TaskRO, we can just directly call Task.addTask() right?
A more appropriate name would be shouldCommit or something.
timeline.author: ChinmaySKulkarni

replies.bodyText:
This is used just for the index rebuild task that gets triggered from the client-side, right? For the tasks that are triggered from the server (i.e. from MetaDataEndpointImpl and TaskRO, we can just directly call Task.addTask() right?

That's right, both of above are correct. Sure, let me rename it to shouldCommit, that one sounds better.
replies.author: virajjasani

PHOENIX-6155 : Provide a coprocessor endpoint to avoid direct upserts into SYSTEM.TASK from the client

timeline.bodyText:
We should rename this test since we are no longer just checking that the split policy is updated. Also, better if we can do something like the following:

Connect with an old client: If <4.15, SYS.TASK doesn't even exist, so nothing to do. If 4.15, confirm that SYS.TASK doesn't have the coproc loaded.
Then connect with a new client (4.16) which will trigger the metadata upgrade and update the coproc. Now do your check for existence of the coproc. Similarly can be done for the split policy too.
